project_overview.name: InstaClone App Development
project_overview.description: Develop a mobile application replicating core Instagram features, including user registration/login, photo/video uploading, following/follower functionality, liking/commenting, and direct messaging.
project_overview.team_size: 5-7 (Backend Developers, Frontend Developers, UI/UX Designer, QA Tester, Project Manager)
objectives: Develop a functional and user-friendly InstaClone app with core Instagram features.
Achieve a user base of 10,000 within the first 3 months of launch.
Maintain a 4.5-star rating on app stores.
success_criteria: Successful deployment of the application on iOS and Android platforms.
Positive user feedback and engagement metrics.

phase1.name: Backend Development and API Design
phase1.overview: This phase focuses on building the server-side logic, database architecture, and API endpoints for the InstaClone app.
objectives: Develop a robust and scalable backend infrastructure.
Design and implement RESTful APIs for core app functionalities.

sub1.name: Database Design and Implementation
sub1.description: Design and implement the database schema for user data, posts, followers, and other relevant information.
tasks: Test database performance and optimize queries.

risks: Database scalability issues - Mitigate by using a scalable database solution and optimizing queries.
API security vulnerabilities - Mitigate by implementing robust authentication and authorization mechanisms.
milestones: Completion of backend development and API implementation.
Successful testing of API endpoints with integration tests.

phase2.name: Frontend Development
phase2.overview: Develop the User Interface and connect to the backend API
objectives: Develop user-friendly and responsive UI for web and mobile platforms

sub1.name: UI Development
sub1.description: Develop the user interface for the application
tasks: Implement responsive design for different screen sizes

dependencies: Completed backend development and API design
risks: Cross-browser compatibility issues - Mitigate by using cross-browser testing tools and libraries.
Performance issues - Mitigate by optimizing code and assets.
